sentences.english: But I like the arrogant, imperious, imposing, self-willed I.
sentences.chinese: 不過我喜歡高傲，專橫，威風，任性的自己。

sentences.english: Was he so conceited as not to believe in the wisdom of the masses ?
sentences.chinese: 他回如此高傲，竟不相信羣衆的智慧？

sentences.english: I hope they don't think I am stuck-up.
sentences.chinese: 我希望他們不會認爲我很高傲。

sentences.english: Listless game on the small girls in the United States, consistent with the proud, beautiful and arrogant.
sentences.chinese: 神氣的小美妞，帶着一貫的驕傲，美麗而高傲。

sentences.english: That wreath, the pride of Ephraim 's drunkards, will be trampled underfoot.
sentences.chinese: 以法蓮的醉漢所戴的高傲冠冕，必被踐踏在腳下。

sentences.english: He is a proud tod that will not scrape his own hole.
sentences.chinese: 再高傲的狐狸也得自己打洞。

sentences.english: Don't know why HuiZhen curator of the position of the induction of proud fast.
sentences.chinese: 不曉得緣由的惠珍對館長高傲的立場感應不快。

sentences.english: This kind of sentiment is a very interesting combination of superiority and inferiority.
sentences.chinese: 這種情感是非常有趣的，是一種高傲和自卑的結合體。

sentences.english: He had an affable and haughty air, and a mouth which was always smiling, since it did not shut.
sentences.chinese: 他的態度和藹而高傲，有一張合不攏的嘴，老在笑。

sentences.english: There is a generation, O how lofty are their eyes! and their eyelids are lifted up.
sentences.chinese: 有一宗人，眼目何其高傲，眼皮也是高舉。

sentences.english: The officer was supercilious and self-conceited.
There is in all animals a sense of duty that man condescends to call instinct.
sentences.chinese: 所有的動物都有一種責任感，而人高傲的稱之爲本能。

sentences.english: Too proud art thou to kill these sweet-tooths.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你太高傲了，不會殺死這些貪食者。

sentences.english: In case there is some confusion, pride is different from dignity.
sentences.chinese: 這裏要區別一下高貴和高傲，以免混淆概念。

sentences.english: Proud as these two moneybags are, they are afraid to see me.
sentences.chinese: 儘管兩個大款很高傲，他們都害怕來見我。

sentences.english: And no more stalking the barefoot contessa through 1770 house.
sentences.chinese: 還沒有高傲的伯爵夫人走過1770號的房子。

definition: the eye can see nothing worthwhile all around (idiom); arrogant/condescending/supercilious
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to consider oneself unexcelled in the world/to be insufferably arrogant
noble and virtuous/aloof from politics and material pursuits
